result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T. Smulders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence(s) previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with anyone under the age of 18 w/exception of nieces/nephews/grandchildren with supervision as approved by agent.

Shall submit a DNA sample.
Shall comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Shall submit to random UAs when requested by agent.
Computer/Internet/Social Networking use all at discretion of agent.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment & Sex Offender Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
